channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Yellow barrier abandoned outside No.23 - blocking pavement., 16th January
item.description:
Pavement repairs were completed at this location more than two weeks ago. A yellow barrier was left behind and is lying flat on the pavement, blocking it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sheringham Road, Anerley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken glass and rubbbish in the usual dumping spot on Lassell Street by Orlop Street, 16th January
item.description:
Builders have left this broken glass and there’s other rubbish here. I’d be grateful if someone could clear it.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Trafalgar Road, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: On the Left hand side, 16th January
item.description:
A massive hole that keeps getting bigger; I almost broke my car. Please fix it. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): West Heath Road, West Hampstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bins all tagged and always on pavement, 16th January
item.description:
Outside 427 sidcup service road. 2 green bins both tagged from council and recycle and black bin always on pavement. All smashed glass from them overfilling bins on pavement. Please take the green bins away as they have had months to sort the tagged bins out. The whole street has not been cleaned since last summer.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Sidcup Road, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pedestrian area, 16th January
item.description:
Repeated fly tipping at this location

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Priory Park Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Fly-tip Medium - Up to medium size van load

item.title: Dangerous pothole in middle of lane - high risk to cyclists, 16th January
item.description:
There is a pothole in the middle of the lane heading SE (from Underhill towards Wood Vale) that is large enough to easily catch a bike tyre and send the rider flying. Very dangerous!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Langton Rise, East Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bike racks outside Pure Gym, Drummond Rd, Abandoned bike and lock, 16th January
item.description:
On the bike racks outside Pure Gym Bermondsey, Drummond Rd, There’s a clearly abandoned bike with no wheels or seat and a very rusty chain. On another one of the bike racks (nearer the gym entrance) there’s an abandoned bike d-lock and cable lock (the cable lock has been cut in two). Please could you remove, so people can use the bike racks, and to avoid attracting more litter. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Drummond Road, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Constant Dog Poo, 16th January
item.description:
There is a large dog poo on the road outside number 82 Reighton Road. There are often the same sized dog poo on different points along the road for a long time now - someone is clearly not picking up after their dog at all.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Reighton Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
